Functions

theme_footer¶

A drop-in replacement for WordPress' get_footer()

NOTE: This is largely copied from the WordPress 4.2.2 core Improvements: - Function variables do not interfere with included file - Returns the the return value of the file - Better Debugging - Supports overrides via template_use_part() - Also checks content directory
« More »

template_part__load¶

A drop-in replacement for WordPress' load_template()

Improvements: - Function variables do not interfere with included file - Returns the the return value of the file - Better Debugging - Supports overrides via template_use_part()
« More »

template_use_part¶

This allows you to replace anything that hasn't been fetched by template_part() yet, and you know the $slug to.

« More »

theme_sidebar¶

A drop-in replacement for WordPress' get_sidebar()

NOTE: This is largely copied from the WordPress 4.2.2 core Improvements: - Function variables do not interfere with included file - Returns the the return value of the file - Better Debugging - Support overrides via template_use_part() - Also checks content directory
« More »

template_part¶

A drop-in replacement for WordPress' get_template_part()

NOTE: This is largely copied from the WordPress 4.2.2 core Improvements: - Function variables do not interfere with included file - Returns the the return value of the file - Better Debugging - Supports overrides via template_use_part()
« More »

theme_header¶

A drop-in replacement for WordPress' get_header()

NOTE: This is largely copied from the WordPress 4.2.2 core Improvements: - Function variables do not interfere with included file - Returns the the return value of the file - Better Debugging - Support overrides via template_use_part() - Also checks content directory
« More »

template_part__locate¶

A drop-in replacement for WordPress' locate_template()

NOTE: This is almost entirely copied from the WordPress 4.2.2 core Improvements: - Function variables do not interfere with included file - Uses is_file() instead of file_exists() - Better Debugging
« More »

Classes, interfaces and traits

abstract_base¶

Base Class

This class allows you to add any common functionality to all the other classes. In this case we are just adding some debugging info.
« More »

abstract_base¶

The customer walker base class

« More »

abstract_nav_menu¶

This class is a 1 for 1 duplicate of `Walker_Nav_Menu` from 4.3.1 except it extends `semantic\walker\abstract_base` instead of `Walker`

« More »

debug¶

This class carries out all the debug functionality

This class allows you to add any common functionality to all the other classes. In this case we are just adding some debugging info.
« More »

integrations¶

WordPress integrations class

This class class holds all the functions that integrate directly with WordPress
« More »

nav_menu¶

Custom nav menu walker class

« More »

shutdown¶

Shutdown Class

This class helps handle what happens when PHP exits. This is very useful for doing last second tasks.
« More »

theme¶

Theme Class

This class handles various parts of the theme, including common variables, fetching/updating options, and how some parts of the page are generated.
